DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number that represents the frequency of gene amplifications.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any DNA sequence rearrangement that results in the gain of one or more copies of a DNA segment that contains at least one gene._The ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any DNA sequence rearrangement that results in the gain of one or more copies of a DNA segment that contains at least one gene.

Concepts.definition: Any DNA sequence rearrangement that results in the gain of one or more copies of a DNA segment that contains at least one gene.

Property.preferredDefinition: The ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.

Concepts.definition: The ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A computed numerical quantity that represents the ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
